problem_text: A ball is launched horizontally at speed \(v_0\) from a table of height \(h\). (a) Determine the time to hit the floor and the horizontal distance. (b) Show that the fall time is independent of \(v_0\).
diagram_request: Horizontal launch from height h; straight horizontal velocity arrow; parabolic descent.
solution_steps: Solve h - (1/2) g t^2 = 0 â†’ t = sqrt(2h/g).
Time to fall depends only on h and g.
common_mistakes: Incorrectly coupling horizontal and vertical motion
